page.title: 05HOUSING IN CALDER VALE
page.content: {Terraced houses: }These were built from the 1830's onwards to house the mill workers. Some of these houses are still owned by the mill authorities and although fairly small, they are very well maintained. Many of them back straight on to the valley sides and as a result have exceedingly long and steep gardens. The names of these terraces are Long Row, Albert Terrace, Victoria Terrace, and The Holme. These are stone built. { {Semi detatched houses: }There is an estate of local authority built semi detatched houses in Calder Vale. They are of typical 1930's design of brick and pebble dash. They are situated on the flatter land above the village and known as Burnside.
